## some() function

Returns `true` if at least one element in the `array` satisfies an async test. The `Promise` returned by each `iterator` call can only returns boolean value! Once any iterator call returns `true`<!-- -->, the main `Promise` is resolved.

<b>Signature:</b>

```typescript
export default function some<T>(array: T[], iterator: AsyncListIterator<T, boolean>): Promise<boolean>;
```

## Parameters

|  Parameter | Type | Description |
|  --- | --- | --- |
|  array | T\[\] | The array to iterate on |
|  iterator | [AsyncListIterator](./promizr.asynclistiterator.md)<!-- -->&lt;T, boolean&gt; | The iterator which test each item |

<b>Returns:</b>

Promise&lt;boolean&gt;
